title: Texas Instruments' 4Q Forecast Misses Wall Street Targets; 3Q Results Worsen on Market Weakening — Earnings Review
text:
By Maria Armental

Texas Instruments Inc. (TXN) reported third-quarter results on Tuesday. Here's what you need to know:

PROFIT: Net income fell 9% to $1.43 billion, or $1.49 a share. The company projected $1.21 to $1.53 a share, while analysts surveyed by FactSet expected $1.42 a share.

REVENUE: Revenue fell 11.5% to $3.77 billion. The company forecast about $3.65 billion to $3.95 billion, while analysts projected $3.82 billion.

MARGIN: Gross profit margin narrowed to 64.9% from 65.8% a year earlier.

OUTLOOK: This quarter, the Dallas-based chipmaker projects profit of 91 cents to $1.09 a share and $3.07 billion to $3.33 billion in revenue, compared with the consensus forecast of $1.28 a share in profit and $3.57 billion in revenue.

Write to Maria Armental at maria.armental@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 22, 2019 16:24 ET (20:24 GMT)
